page.title: 18HAVANT THICKET-DESCRIPTION
page.content: Havant Thicket,set on Horsefoot Hill,is part of the ancient wood called Forest of Bere,and is located within the parish of Rowlands Castle. The Forestry Commission owns and looks after the woodland for outdoor recreation for local people.It is next to a busy main road,but when you enter the wood it feels as though you are entering another world. The area we visited is mostly deciduous ,but around the centre are some yew and pine.The pond area in the north-west was damaged by fire in 1976,but about ten years later the damaged part still has not recovered, and the burnt patch is quite large. To help people enjoy experiencing the woodland of Havant Thicket,St.John'First & Middle School has set up a nature trail which we followed.by Louise Farres and A.West.
